channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Bears are leaving Modelo and Corona beer parent's stock ahead of earnings
You can own one of Tom Brady’s watches—if you’re willing to shell out up to $800,000
item.description: The seven-time Super Bowl–winning quarterback's Sotheby’s auction begins in December.

item.title: OpenAI closes funding at $157 billion valuation, as Microsoft, Nvidia, SoftBank join round
item.description: OpenAI closed its long-awaited funding round, announcing that it raised $6.6 billion at a $157 billion post-money valuation.

item.title: Two major news outlets introduce paywalls for article access
item.description: CNN and Reuters both institute pay walls.

item.title: America’s corporate tax rate is right where it should be
item.description: 'The reality is that the growth in jobs and wages is contingent on a healthy private sector,' writes former chair of Ways and Means Committee Kevin Br...

item.title: LVMH and Formula One announce 10-year partnership
item.description: Liberty Media-owned Formula One and luxury giant LVMH are entering into a 10-year partnership, according to a joint press release from Wednesday after...

item.title: More renters think Harris is the better candidate on housing, survey finds
item.description: Close to a third think Donald Trump would be better, according to Redfin.

item.title: Trump Media stock is up 19% over the last 5 days
item.description: The price spiked on Tuesday after a flood of shares began trading as the market opened.

item.title: Israel retaliation may target Iran oil infrastructure, boosting prices further, analysts say
item.description: For months, traders have largely dismissed the risk of a supply disruption in the Middle East, but the threat is growing.

item.title: Blue-chip Dow turns positive near midmorning, led by Salesforce and UnitedHealth
Vance linked immigration with housing costs in debate. Here’s what the Fed says.
Stock market typically cools off in October following a really strong third quarter
item.description: A weak month could be the set-up for a year-end buying opportunity, according to Piper Sandler.

item.title: China stock ETFs rip higher even as mainland markets close for holiday
item.description: Exchange-traded funds overseas that track Chinese stocks continued their rally Wednesday even as mainland markets were shut for a week-long holiday.

item.title: One U.S. airline stock expected to retain world-leader status for years to come
